results.title: Circus at the zoo
results.brief_description: Witty old chimpanzee hosts the audience through a performance by the Chimp Circus. Other chimps ride ponies, unicycles and trapeze and finish with a big band finale.

results.title: Circus
results.creator_credit: Heller Films and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of Zane, a twelve-year-old boy who samples life under the big top when he travels with the family circus in New Zealand during his school holidays. Shows Zane performing tasks in the daily circus routine as well as training and playing with the lion that he has brought up from a cub. The roles played by other members of the circus team are also noted, and a final sequence depicts a circus performance, including Zane’s first time in the ring with Nero, his lion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Circulatory System [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.

results.title: Circulation of the blood
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and Beryl Denman Lacey
results.brief_description: A study, mainly in animated diagram, of the systematic and pulmonary circulation of the blood in the human body; showing the structure and functions of the heart, lungs, arteries, veins and capillary network. The route of the blood, the heart cycle and the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide in the air sacs of the lungs and the cells of the body are shown in detail.

results.title: Circulation and the human body. -- Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the needs of the body’s cells and how some of these needs are serviced by the circulation system. It details how blood returns from the capillaries to the heart through the venous system, and how the chambers of the heart pump the blood through the pulmonary circulation, then back through the arterial system to the capillaries.

results.title: Circular saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
The film starts with a short description of a saw bench and stresses the point that saws must be kept sharp. Machine sharpening is demonstrated, followed by hand sharpening and setting. Special types of saws, inserted tooth saw, swage saw and novelty tooth saw, are described. After sharpening, the rip saw is replaced on its spindle and packing inserted. Safety precautions saw guard, riving knife and push stick, are shown. A cross-cut saw is demonstrated. Adjustment for angle cutting, use of trenching heads for cutting housings.
